title: People die every week in national parks, learn to stay safe
description: On average, six people die every week in the National Park system according to officials. The parks work hard and offer tips to keep hundreds of millions of yearly visitors safe.

title: Opinion: Whatever happened to Jared Kushner's peace plan?
description: Last year, former President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu unveiled their peace plan for the Middle East at the White House. Now, 16 months later, the question that begs to be asked is whether that plan has worked at all.

title: AOC just made Marjorie Taylor Greene's antics suddenly serious
Unclaimed $26 million lottery ticket may have been washed with laundry
description: It looks like a $26 million dollar lottery jackpot will go unclaimed in California because no one came forward with the winning ticket.

title: Reckoning with lethal violence in Colombia's prolonged wave of protests
description: How much pain can one bear in the fight for a worthy cause?

title: Why Hawaii's governor is keeping state's mask mandate
description: Gov. David Ige (D-HI) says he's keeping his state's mask mandate despite CDC guidance that it's safe for vaccinated individuals to go maskless in most indoor and outdoor situations.

title: Terrified families huddle together in Gaza as Eid festivities turn into nights of death and destruction
description: The family of 30-year-old journalist Reema Saad gathered to sleep in a single room on Wednesday night to comfort each other as Israeli bombs rained down on Gaza.

title: Analysis: Boris Johnson is deliberately dividing his country
description: Boris Johnson's having a pretty great spring. The success of the UK Prime Minister's coronavirus rollout coupled with the fast-approaching end of lockdown undoubtedly played a significant role in his Conservative party exceeding expectations at local elections last week.

title: 'Hollywood forgot me': McConaughey opens up about his career
description: Academy Award-winning actor Matthew McConaughey speaks to Christiane about his memoir 'Greenlights' and his three decade career in Hollywood.

title: How two brothers went from nearly jobless to multi-millionaires with a bizarre crypto bet
description: On the morning of April 17, two brothers in Westchester, New York, woke up to learn that they had become millionaires overnight, thanks to an unlikely wager on a cryptocurrency that was originally created as a joke.

title: One of Kenya's top scientists has a warning for the world
description: Covid-19 vaccine supplies are nearly depleted in Kenya, prompting fears among health experts. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports.

title: Bill Maher thanks fans following Covid-19 diagnosis
description: Bill Maher sounds more concerned with missing his show than testing positive for Covid-19.

title: Ocasio-Cortez speaks about Marjorie Taylor Greene confrontation
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) called Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) "deeply unwell" after Greene confronted Ocasio-Cortez in the halls of Congress.

title: Emily Ratajkowski's 'reclaimed' self-portrait sells for $175,000
description: In April, model and actress Emily Ratajkowski announced on Twitter that she was "reclaiming" her image by selling a photograph of herself through a major auction house, Christie's. The "conceptual artwork," titled "Buying Myself Back: A Model for Redistribution" sold Friday in New York for $175,000 after fees.

title: These are some of the children killed in Gaza
description: A family cries out questioning why their 11-year-old boy was killed. Another family lost several children, including a boy who was just two years old. CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

title: CNN correspondent reports in midst of tear gas and hurled rocks in West Bank
description: CNN's Ben Wedeman reports in the midst of violent clashes between Israeli forces and Palestinian protesters in the West Bank, describing the tense scene as the "curse of the Holy Land."

title: Depression almost killed him. Food, fitness and fortitude brought him back
description: Ever since he was a child, Kevin Curry would pray for God to "fix" him and take away his sadness. Now the author of "Fit Men Cook," Curry shares six strategies for people struggling with depression and anxiety.

title: Monica and Rachel's 'Friends' apartment is on Booking.com
description: "Friends" fans are being given the chance to crash for a night at Monica and Rachel's apartment.

title: Russia announces actor and director for first-ever movie made in space
description: Russia is racing to become the first nation to shoot a movie in space, after it announced plans to send an actress and a director to the International Space Station (ISS) -- 250 miles above earth -- in October.

title: UK may start vaccinating young people in hotspots to combat spread of India variant
description: Growing concerns over the spread of the coronavirus variant first identified in India may force the United Kingdom to tweak its Covid-19 vaccination program to prioritize people in the most affected areas, a top health official said Friday.

title: Late-night hosts weren't always so political. Here's why they changed
description: If you enter American politics, especially at the highest level, you understand two things: The media will hold you up to unrelenting scrutiny; and the late-night TV hosts will hold you up to unrelenting ridicule.

title: Singer Tank reveals he's going deaf
description: R & B singer Tank is speaking out about losing his hearing, in an effort to help others who may face similar problems.

title: White House not bending to pressure to condemn Israel
description: President Joe Biden and the White House are showing little willingness to bend to pressure from liberal Democrats calling for more robust condemnation of Israel's actions amid the worst regional violence in years.

title: Israel directed heavy artillery and airstrikes to Gaza as fears grew of a ground operation to quell rocket fire from Palestinian militants
Broadway is bringing pop up concerts to Tavern on the Green
description: Broadway stars will be popping up around New York City this summer.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla is pushing ahead with "full self-driving" a month after fatal crash
description: Tesla seems ready to move forward with a broader roll out of its autonomous driving software after a federal government investigation raised questions about initial, headline-grabbing findings from a fatal Tesla crash in Spring, Texas, last month.

title: Cat jumps from fifth floor of burning building, bounces and strolls away
description: A Chicago cat used up at least one of its nine lives on Thursday when it leaped from the fifth story of a burning building, bounced off the ground and casually walked away.

title: Ransomware took down the Colonial Pipeline. You could be at risk too
description: Ransomware attacks draw headlines when they take down major operations: hospitals, cities and most recently, a US fuel pipeline. Not only do cybercriminals scam businesses demanding large sums of money or they'll wreak havoc on their computer systems, this week's gas shortages showed how it can also have broader impacts.

title: What Disney, Airbnb and DoorDash results reveal about the post-pandemic economy
description: Companies are gearing up for an era in which Covid-19 isn't the primary driver of how people spend their money.

title: Lab rats are overwhelmingly male, and that's a problem
description: The data didn't make sense.

title: Nicki Minaj is obsessed with 'The Crown' -- like, really obsessed
description: Nicki Minaj says she is "obsessing" over "The Crown" after binge-watching seasons of the royal drama.

title: Hyundai and Kia are spending $7 billion in US electric car push
description: Hyundai and Kia are pouring billions of dollars into the United States, where they plan to start building electric cars and invest more in futuristic technologies.

title: Top Japanese CEO says hosting the Olympics amounts to a 'suicide mission'
How John Deere is helping Black farmers and their descendents take back unjustly seized land
description: It's been nine years since Michael Robinson of Columbus, Ohio, nearly lost a major part of his family's legacy. He's still fighting to regain full control of it.

title: Can 'ghost kitchens' help save South Africa's restaurants?
description: Restauranteur Piers Proctor-Irwin has spent the majority of the past year surrounded by empty chairs and tables. Situated in a suburb on the outskirts of Johannesburg, South Africa, his restaurant The Local Kitchen Co. shuttered after the South African government announced a nationwide lockdown last March.

title: New York gets dizzying new glass elevator ride
description: Ever wondered what it would be like to take a glass elevator ride up the side of one of New York's tallest skyscrapers?

title: The death of a high school student has exposed a credibility crisis for Chinese authorities
description: "Truth! Truth! Truth," shouted the dozens of people gathered outside a Chinese high school on Tuesday in a video widely circulated online. Holding white flowers, they demanded to know why a 17-year-old boy had suddenly fallen to his death on campus that weekend.

title: Nigerian fashion pioneer will be celebrated at 'Africa Fashion' exhibition
description: She's been called one of Africa's most important designers, and a pioneering figure in Nigerian fashion.

title: As US pulls out of Afghanistan, China sees opportunities -- and potential for chaos
description: China is conflicted about Afghanistan.

title: Removed from royal display, Meghan and Harry waxworks join Madame Tussauds' 'party zone'
description: Madame Tussauds in London has revealed that Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's waxworks are -- like their real-life counterparts -- beginning a new chapter among the Hollywood elite.

title: The Chinese county famed for its double-yolk duck eggs
description: "Would you like salted duck egg with that?" asked the cook.

title: The man who accused Kevin Spacey of sexual assault will not identify himself, setting up dismissal of his lawsuit
description: The civil lawsuit against actor Kevin Spacey that alleges he sexually assaulted a teenager in the 1980s is expected to be dismissed after attorneys for the accuser on Thursday said he refused to identify himself.

title: Oxygen crisis unfolds as climbers chase Everest dreams
description: India's brutal second wave of coronavirus has spilled into neighboring Nepal, including Mount Everest. Despite the government's denial, a tour company told CNN more than 30 of their Everest clients have tested positive in Nepal. CNN's Anna Coren speaks with a veteran climber who aborted his trip for fear of catching Covid-19 on the mountain.

title: The conflict in Ethiopia's Tigray region explained
description: CNN's Zain Asher explains the history behind the conflict in Ethiopia's war-torn northern Tigray region.

title: CNN gets look inside Arizona recount
description: CNN's Kyung Lah and crew gain access into the Republican election audit of the 2020 ballots from Arizona's largest county.
